intro: Tadehagi rodgeri, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain brome, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a grass species that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, often found on rocky slopes and in open vegetation. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers. It has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Tadehagi rodgeri plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
